p: A total of eight Sirius cultivar parameters related with different important plant traits, viz. growth rate, phenological development, response to abiotic stresses etc., were selected to design wheat ideotypes for increasing yield potential due to their a) large natural variations observed in wheat germplasms, b) potential for improvement through genetic adaptation, and c) importance in improving wheat yield under future climate change ( Semenov et al., 2014; Semenov and Stratonovitch, 2013). The targeted traits are summarized in Table 3 and described briefly below.
